duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform initial-response screening and escort patients to exam room.
Obtain vital signs, record patient history, and prepare for examinations and treatments.
Prepare, administer, and document medications and immunizations as ordered.
Respond to patient requests and enter medication, radiology, and lab orders in the electronic health record.
Schedule appointments, procedures, referrals, and apply third party and managed care policies.
Participate in Quality Assessment and Quality Improvement Programs, practicing standard precautions and aseptic technique.
Educate patients in office policies, procedures, health maintenance, and disease prevention.
Uphold goals, policies, and expectations of the healthcare system and maintain examination/treatment rooms.
Perform a wide variety of clinical skills related to ambulatory patient care, problem-solving, and effective communication.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent. Basic computer knowledge preferred. Professionally Recognized Medical Assistant Certification preferred. Graduate of a Medical Assistant program with clinical externship, or equivalent experience.
